step1.sentence: Before signing the contract, make sure you do your homework on the company's financial history.

step2.story: Mia was excited about the investment opportunity, but her mentor warned her to do her homework first. She spent a week researching the market, and her thorough preparation paid off when she spotted a hidden risk others had missed.

step3.story: When Daniel was shortlisted for the senior manager position, he knew the panel interview would be tough. He decided to do his homework: he read the company's annual reports, studied its competitors, and even reached out to a former employee for insights. Walking into the conference room, he felt calm and ready. The interviewers were visibly impressed when he referenced specific quarterly figures and proposed a realistic growth strategy. His preparation made all the difference, and he received the offer by the end of the week.

meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 어떤 일을 시작하기 전에 충분히 조사하고 준비하다는 의미로 쓰인다. 비즈니스, 투자, 협상, 취업 등 중요한 결정 앞에서 자주 등장한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 학교에서 교사가 '숙제를 해 오라'고 하듯, 어떤 주제에 대해 미리 공부해 온다는 학교 교육 맥락에서 유래하여 일반적인 사전 조사·준비의 의미로 확장되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 준비를 넘어 '제대로, 철저히' 조사했다는 뉘앙스를 담고 있다. 충분한 준비 없이 행동하는 사람을 지적할 때도 'You didn't do your homework'처럼 사용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You should do your homework before negotiating the price.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 가격 협상을 시작하기 전에 충분히 조사해 두어야 한다.
